conversation.content: [shaky voice] Ela disse remissão. [pause] Ela falou mesmo a palavra remissão. [gasp softly] Fico ouvindo na minha cabeça como se não fosse real. [very quietly] Oito meses daquele protocolo experimental e... funcionou? [laugh] Meu Deus do céu, funcionou mesmo. [cry] Preciso ligar pra minha mãe. [sniffling] Não, péra, eu devia— eu devia sentar primeiro. [deep breath] Minhas pernas tão bambas. [crying while speaking] Todas aquelas noites vomitando, todas as agulhas, os efeitos colaterais esquisitos que nem estavam na literatura porque ninguém sabia o que ia acontecer— [laugh hard] e funcionou! [extremely happy] Vou poder ver a Emma se formar. [cry loudly] Vou poder— vou poder fazer tudo. [whispering] Obrigado, obrigado, obrigado. [shaky voice] Eu tinha tanta certeza quando ela me chamou mais cedo que era, hum... que era notícia ruim. [relieved] Mas ela tava com um sorriso, um sorrisão enorme. [very excited] Daqui a seis meses a gente faz outro exame mas ela disse— [confidently] ela disse que não tá preocupada. [warm] Ela não tá mais preocupada comigo. [pause] Eu vou viver. [extremely happy] Eu vou viver de verdade.

original_conversation.content: [shaky voice] She said remission. [pause] She actually said the word remission. [gasp softly] I keep hearing it in my head like it's not real. [very quietly] Eight months of that experimental protocol and it... it worked? [laugh] Oh my god, it actually worked. [cry] I need to call Mom. [sniffling] Wait, no, I should— I should sit down first. [deep breath] My legs feel like jello. [crying while speaking] All those nights throwing up, all the needles, the weird side effects that weren't even in the literature because nobody knew what would happen— [laugh hard] and it worked! [extremely happy] I get to see Emma graduate. [cry loudly] I get to— I get to do everything. [whispering] Thank you, thank you, thank you. [shaky voice] I was so sure when she called me in early that it was, um... that it was bad news. [relieved] But she had this smile, this huge smile. [very excited] Six months from now we do another scan but she said— [confidently] she said she's not worried. [warm] She's not worried about me anymore. [pause] I'm going to live. [extremely happy] I'm really going to live.

subject: Getting the news that your experimental treatment worked and you're in remission
